title: IDG Meeting CRUD Controller
description:
Develop IDG Meeting Documentation Controller with Automated CMS 14-Day Compliance Enforcement

Build a robust controller system that manages Interdisciplinary Group (IDG) meeting documentation lifecycle while automatically enforcing Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) regulatory requirements mandating completion within 14 calendar days of the meeting occurrence.

Core Functionality:

API Endpoints:
- POST /idg-meetings/documentation - Create new meeting documentation
- GET /idg-meetings/documentation/:id - Retrieve specific documentation
- PUT /idg-meetings/documentation/:id - Update existing documentation
- DELETE /idg-meetings/documentation/:id - Remove documentation (with audit trail)
- GET /idg-meetings/documentation/pending - List all pending documentation with deadline status
- GET /idg-meetings/documentation/compliance-report - Generate compliance metrics

Business Logic Requirements:

Deadline Calculation & Enforcement:
- Calculate 14-day deadline from meeting date (calendar days, not business days)
- Use meeting date at 00:00:00 local time as start reference
- Deadline expires at 23:59:59 on the 14th day
- Block final submission of documentation after deadline expiration
- Allow draft saves at any time, but enforce deadline on final submission
- Display real-time countdown showing days/hours remaining until deadline

Validation Rules:
- Verify meeting date is not in the future when creating documentation
- Reject final submissions exceeding 14-day window with specific CMS regulation reference
- Validate required documentation fields are complete before allowing final submission
- Check user authorization level before processing any documentation action
- Prevent modification of meeting date after documentation has been finalized

Alert & Notification System:
- Trigger notifications at configurable intervals: 10 days, 7 days, 3 days, 1 day, same day
- Send alerts to assigned documentation owners
- Escalate to supervisors if documentation remains incomplete at 2 days remaining
- Include meeting details, patient information (if applicable), and direct link in notifications
- Support multiple notification channels (email, in-app, SMS)

Override & Exception Handling:
- Require supervisor/administrator role for late submission override
- Mandate justification text (minimum 50 characters) for all overrides
- Flag overridden submissions distinctly in compliance reports
- Send automatic notification to compliance team when override is used
- Limit override capability to specific user roles defined in authorization matrix

Audit & Compliance:
- Log all actions with timestamp, user ID, and action type (create, update, delete, override)
- Record IP address and user agent for all documentation operations
- Track status transitions (draft → submitted → approved → overridden)
- Maintain immutable audit log that cannot be altered post-creation
- Generate monthly compliance reports showing:
  * Total meetings held
  * On-time completion rate (percentage)
  * Average completion time
  * Late submissions with reasons
  * Override usage statistics
  * Trend analysis (improving/declining compliance)

Technical Implementation:

Timezone Handling:
- Store all timestamps in UTC in database
- Convert to facility's local timezone for deadline calculations
- Account for Daylight Saving Time transitions
- Use facility's configured timezone from organization settings
- Display all dates/times to users in their local timezone

Data Validation:
- Verify meeting record exists before allowing documentation creation
- Ensure documentation is not duplicated for the same meeting
- Validate data integrity for all required CMS documentation fields
- Check for conflicts if multiple users attempt simultaneous edits
- Implement optimistic locking to prevent data loss

Error Handling:
- Return HTTP 422 with detailed error message when 14-day deadline exceeded
- Provide user-friendly messages referencing specific CMS regulation (e.g., "42 CFR §418.56")
- Include days overdue in error response
- Suggest contacting supervisor for override in error message
- Log all validation failures for monitoring

Edge Cases & Special Scenarios:

Meeting Date Scenarios:
- Weekend/Holiday Meetings: 14-day countdown continues regardless of calendar type
- Backdated Entries: Validate against original meeting date; flag if already non-compliant at creation time
- Date Corrections: If meeting date changes, recalculate deadline and re-trigger notification schedule
- Future-Dated Meetings: Prevent documentation creation until meeting date occurs

Operational Scenarios:
- Bulk Import: Validate each record individually; generate summary report of compliant vs. non-compliant entries
- System Downtime: Provide administrative grace period extension capability for documented outages
- Partial Saves: Allow unlimited draft saves; only enforce deadline on final submission action
- Auto-Save Functionality: Save drafts every 2 minutes without triggering validation
- Session Timeout: Preserve draft state; warn user if deadline approaching during active session

Data Migration:
- Historical data import should preserve original timestamps
- Flag legacy records that were non-compliant at time of entry
- Allow bulk compliance status updates with administrator approval

Integration Requirements:

Required System Integrations:
- Meeting Scheduler: Retrieve meeting dates, attendees, and patient associations
- Authentication Service: Verify user identity and role-based permissions
- Authorization Service: Check override privileges and documentation access rights
- Notification Engine: Queue and deliver multi-channel alerts
- Audit System: Persist immutable log entries
- Reporting Service: Aggregate compliance data for dashboards

Data Dependencies:
- User roles and permissions matrix
- Facility timezone configuration
- Meeting metadata (date, type, participants)
- Notification templates and delivery preferences
- Compliance reporting requirements and schedules

Security & Compliance:

Access Control:
- Implement role-based access: viewer, editor, approver, administrator
- Restrict deletion to administrator role only
- Require documentation owner or supervisor role for updates
- Audit all access attempts including denied requests

Data Privacy:
- Ensure PHI (Protected Health Information) handling complies with HIPAA
- Implement field-level encryption for sensitive patient data
- Redact patient identifiers in audit logs
- Support data retention policies per regulatory requirements

Performance Targets:
- API response time < 200ms for read operations
- Deadline calculation must complete in < 50ms
- Support concurrent users: minimum 100 simultaneous documentation editors
- Notification queue processing: deliver within 5 minutes of trigger event
- Compliance report generation: complete within 30 seconds for 1 year of data

Success Criteria:
- Zero documentation submissions accepted after 14-day deadline (without override)
- 100% of meetings tracked with deadline status visible
- Automated notifications reduce late submissions by 50% compared to manual tracking
- Audit trail captures all required data points for CMS compliance reviews
- Compliance reports generate accurately with < 1% margin of error
